intro: Phyllanthus chamaecerasus var. aoupinieensis, commonly known as the Aoupinie endemic goosefoot, is a shrub native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, alternate leaves that are often succulent and have a distinctive waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by spherical, fleshy fruits. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
